newsitem.title: USA: Micro-Integration to post loss on sale.
newsitem.headline: Micro-Integration to post loss on sale.

text.p: Micro-Integration Corp said Monday it has signed a letter of intent to sell its European operations, Micro-Integration Corp Plc.
The U.S. company expects to recognize a loss of about $100,000 on the transaction, after all expenses relating to the sale of and exit from all European operations, the company said.
In addition, the company said it will be able to claim tax benefits for prior losses that were not possible while Micro-Integration Corp Plc was a wholly-owned subsidiary.
The majority of Micro-Integration Corp Plc will be purchased by its former managing director, Gabor Weiner.

Micro-Integration Corp will retain a 20 percent interest in Micro-Integration Corp Plc and John Parsons, Micro-Integration Corp chief executive and chief financial officer will remain a director, the company said.
The company said the European company contributed "substantially" to the losses Micro-Integration Corp incurred during the first nine months of the company's current fiscal year, which ends March 31.
